attributes.action: Make art industries more accessible to young people regardless of background.
attributes.additional_details:
>Currently only 10% of actors are considered working class

>What do Eddie Redmayne and Benedict Cumberbatch all have in common? They are all public school-educated actors 

>There are not enough reasonably priced local centres and opportunities for young people to seek quality training or experience in the arts. 
(E.g. the 'National Youth Music Theatre' charging £1375-£1875 for a 3-4 week course)

TRAVELLING HUGE DISTANCES, PAYING HUGE SUMS OF MONEY SHOULD NOT BE THE ONLY ROUTE INTO THE ARTS
attributes.background:
>THE ARTS INDUSTRIES ARE CLASS DRIVEN

As a young person who has to travel 53 miles every weekend to attend a quality arts centre, it has made me realise that this shouldn't be the lengths we have to go to, to try and find our way into the arts industries.

rejection.details:
It's clear that you're concerned about access to the arts industries. But we're not sure what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take.

If you could start a petition asking for a clearer action, we could look at this again.
